1.name: A Clockwork Orange
1.description: In the future, a sadistic gang leader is imprisoned and volunteers for a conduct-aversion experiment, but it doesn't go as planned.

2.name: Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory
2.description: A poor but hopeful boy seeks one of the five coveted golden tickets that will send him on a tour of Willy Wonka's mysterious chocolate factory.

3.name: Dirty Harry
3.description: When a mad man calling himself 'the Scorpio Killer' menaces the city, tough as nails San Francisco Police Inspector Harry Callahan is assigned to track down and ferret out the crazed psychopath.

4.name: Diamonds Are Forever
4.description: A diamond smuggling investigation leads James Bond to Las Vegas, where he uncovers an evil plot involving a rich business tycoon.

5.name: Solaris
5.description: A psychologist is sent to a station orbiting a distant planet in order to discover what has caused the crew to go insane.

6.name: Fiddler on the Roof
6.description: In prerevolutionary Russia, a Jewish peasant contends with marrying off three of his daughters while growing anti-Semitic sentiment threatens his village.

7.name: The French Connection
7.description: A pair of NYC cops in the Narcotics Bureau stumble onto a drug smuggling job with a French connection.

8.name: Straw Dogs
8.description: A young American and his English wife come to rural England and face increasingly vicious local harassment.

9.name: The Last Picture Show
9.description: In 1951, a group of high schoolers come of age in a bleak, isolated, atrophied West Texas town that is slowly dying, both culturally and economically.

10.name: Harold and Maude
10.description: Young, rich, and obsessed with death, Harold finds himself changed forever when he meets lively septuagenarian Maude at a funeral.

11.name: Bedknobs and Broomsticks
11.description: An apprentice witch, three kids and a cynical magician conman search for the missing component to a magic spell to be used in the defense of Britain in WWII.

12.name: Walkabout
12.description: Two city-bred siblings are stranded in the Australian Outback, where they learn to survive with the aid of an Aboriginal boy on his "walkabout": a ritual separation from his tribe.

13.name: The Beguiled
13.description: While imprisoned in a Confederate girls' boarding school, an injured Union soldier cons his way into each of the lonely women's hearts, causing them to turn on each other, and eventually, on him.

14.name: The Omega Man
14.description: Army doctor Robert Neville struggles to create a cure for the plague that wiped out most of the human race.

15.name: Vanishing Point
15.description: During the 1970s, car delivery driver Kowalski delivers hot rods in record time but always runs into trouble with the highway cops.

16.name: The Devils
16.description: In 17th-century France, Father Urbain Grandier seeks to protect the city of Loudun from the corrupt establishment of Cardinal Richelieu. Hysteria occurs within the city when he is accused of witchcraft by a sexually repressed nun.

17.name: Play Misty for Me
17.description: A brief fling between a male disc jockey and an obsessed female fan takes a frightening, and perhaps even deadly turn when another woman enters the picture.

18.name: THX 1138
18.description: In the twenty-fifth century, a time when people have designations instead of names, a man, THX 1138, and a woman, LUH 3417, rebel against their rigidly controlled society.

19.name: Minnie and Moskowitz
19.description: A museum curator falls in love with a crazy parking attendant.

20.name: Blood and Lace
20.description: After her prostitute mother and her john are beaten to death while they are asleep in bed, teen-aged Ellie Masters is sent to an isolated orphanage run by Mrs. Deere and her handyman. ...                See full summary »

21.name: Carnal Knowledge
21.description: Chronicling the lifelong sexual development of two men who meet and befriend one another in college.

22.name: Duck, You Sucker
22.description: An I.R.A. explosives expert on the run in Mexico meets an amoral Mexican bandit; together they are drawn into the Mexican revolution.

23.name: Get Carter
23.description: When his brother dies under mysterious circumstances in a car accident, London gangster Jack Carter travels to Newcastle to investigate.

24.name: The Andromeda Strain
24.description: A group of scientists investigate a deadly new alien virus before it can spread.

25.name: Death in Venice
25.description: While recovering in Venice, a sickly composer becomes dangerously fixated with a teenage boy.

26.name: Big Jake
26.description: In 1909, when John Fain's gang kidnaps Jacob McCandles' grandson and holds him for ransom, Big Jake sets out to rescue the boy.

27.name: Shaft
27.description: Cool black private eye John Shaft is hired by a crime lord to find and retrieve his kidnapped daughter.

28.name: Anand
28.description: The story of a terminally ill man who wishes to live life to the full before the inevitable occurs, as told by his best friend.

29.name: Summer of '42
29.description: During his summer vacation on Nantucket Island in 1942, a youth eagerly awaiting his first sexual encounter finds himself developing an innocent love for a young woman awaiting news on her soldier husband's fate in WWII.

30.name: The Abominable Dr. Phibes
30.description: A doctor, scientist, organist, and biblical scholar, Anton Phibes, seeks revenge on the nine doctors he considers responsible for his wife's death.

31.name: Klute
31.description: A small-town detective searching for a missing man has only one lead: a connection with a New York prostitute.

32.name: Billy Jack
32.description: Ex-Green Beret hapkido expert saves wild horses from being slaughtered for dog food and helps protect a desert "freedom school" for runaway.

33.name: The Big Boss
33.description: A young man sworn to an oath of non-violence works with his cousins in an ice factory where they mysteriously begin to disappear.

34.name: Pretty Maids All in a Row
34.description: California State Police Captain Sam Surcher investigates a string of teenage girl murders at Oceanfront High School.

35.name: Johnny Got His Gun
35.description: In this tragic, dark, anti-war satire, a patriotic young American in WW1 is rendered blind, deaf, limbless, and mute by a horrific artillery shell attack. Trapped in what's left of his body, he desperately looks for a way to end his life.

36.name: Daughters of Darkness
36.description: A newlywed couple are passing through a vacation resort. Their paths cross with a mysterious, strikingly beautiful countess and her aide.

37.name: Macbeth
37.description: A ruthlessly ambitious Scottish lord seizes the throne with the help of his scheming wife and a trio of witches.

38.name: Wake in Fright
38.description: After a bad gambling bet, a schoolteacher is marooned in a town full of crazy, drunk, violent men who threaten to make him just as crazy, drunk, and violent.

39.name: Family Life
39.description: A teenage girl suffers a nervous breakdown.

40.name: The Light at the Edge of the World
40.description: A ruthless pirate captures the keeper of a lighthouse, in the most southern city in Argentina. His goal is obvious and horrific. He plans to control the lighthouses signals in a way that the passing ships will be crushed on the rocks.

41.name: Le Mans
41.description: Almost in breadth and depth of a documentary, this movie depicts an auto race during the 70s on the world's hardest endurance course: Le Mans in France. The race goes over 24 hours on 14.5 ...                See full summary »

42.name: Nicholas and Alexandra
42.description: Czar Nicholas II, the inept monarch of Russia, insensitive to the needs of his people, is overthrown and exiled to Siberia with his family.

43.name: McCabe & Mrs. Miller
43.description: A gambler and a prostitute become business partners in a remote Old West mining town, and their enterprise thrives until a large corporation arrives on the scene.

44.name: Willard
44.description: A social misfit uses his only friends, his pet rats, to exact revenge on his tormentors.

45.name: The Panic in Needle Park
45.description: Follows the lives of heroin addicts who frequent "Needle Park" in New York City.

46.name: The Last Movie
46.description: After a film production wraps in Peru, an American wrangler decides to stay behind, witnessing how filmmaking affects the locals.

47.name: Vampyros Lesbos
47.description: An erotic horror tale about a vixen vampiress seducing and killing women to appease her insatiable thirst for female blood.

48.name: The Mephisto Waltz
48.description: Alan Alda's character is a music journalist whose career as a piano player came to an end when his debut concert received undeservedly scathing reviews.

49.name: Soleil rouge
49.description: In 1870, a gang robs a train and steals a ceremonial Japanese sword meant as a gift from Japan to the U.S. President, prompting a manhunt to retrieve it.

50.name: Bananas
50.description: When a bumbling New Yorker is dumped by his activist girlfriend, he travels to a tiny Latin American nation and becomes involved in its latest rebellion.
